website_summaries.verdict: The Epson FastFoto FF-640 is a novelty: a sheet-fed scanner designed for scanning stacks of old photo prints. It does this well, though there are less expensive options for scanning photos, whether individually or in bulk.
pros: Treats photos gently for a sheet-fed scanner
Scans prints of multiple sizes, from wallet size to panoramas
Can scan text from the back of a print
Archives by year, month, and subject
cons: Poor text recognition in document scanning
Archiving functions of the photo-scanning software could be improved

website_summaries.verdict: The Epson FastFoto FF-680W is a sheet-feed desktop scanner that excels at scanning stacks of snapshots while doing a credible job at document scanning.
pros: Quickly scans stacks of photo prints
cons: Slower at photo scanning than its predecessor

customer_reviews.title: Fast scanner for huge projects
customer_reviews.text: We had over 6,000 family photos that we wanted to scan and were looking for a way to get them all into the cloud. This is the only way to go for a large project, since scanning is very fast. I removed a star because occasionally scans would come out stretched or partial, but that was rare. Also, the supporting software is archaic and doesn’t help organize the photos - which is necessary in a large project. I’d recommend scanning and then uploading to Google Photos to help organize all the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul V.

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Saved a huge amount of time, scans several photos quickly, can save 2 copies one original and one auto enhanced, easy auto-file naming my 80 yr old mother is loving scanning all the old photos
customer_reviews.author: Nettrainer

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast scanner
customer_reviews.text: The FF-640 is super fast at scanning photos or anything else. I flew through a box of photos and have been using the scanner instead of my printers scanner (Epson WF-3520) because it is so much faster and the software for the FF-640 is much better. I have experienced all of the problems that reviewers have (dirty lens causing lines, elongated scan/image, etc) but none are a deal breaker. The elongated image has only happened once or twice and the scanner is easy to clean if there are lines showing up. It is so fast to scan photos that a re-scan is no big deal if you are not happy with something.
customer_reviews.author: Spenn

customer_reviews.title: could be better
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for something that worked a bit better, but you get what you pay for. HARDWARE: When scanning stacks of photos, it is quite prone to pull 2-3 photos at a time, making scanning large groups a pain. I had to split the stacks into 4-6 photos per stack, and even then I'd have to re-scan the entire stack due to multiple photos being pulled at the same time. SOFTWARE: With no rhyme or reason, the software randomly orientates the photos however it sees fit - some images upright correctly, some sideways, some upside down. This is far from an easy process, but its manageable with time and patience.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cauthen

customer_reviews.title: It worked better than some of the reviews and had some good surprises!
customer_reviews.text: Although it can be a little finicky, with some thicknesses or bent photos it generally worked well. I was surprised with two settings. Happy to see the auto options to copy the rear of the photo when writing was discovered and to create an improved version with photo correction. Both options are done in the original scan and the additional copy can be deleted later. Very good news, I discovered later you can turn off these functions in settings if you like. I actually liked the photo corrected version in most cases so I set the scanner to save only the corrected photo. A good experience...
customer_reviews.author: Wayne McBrian

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner, a Bit Expensive
customer_reviews.text: While I've used Epson scanners for years, I wasn't disappointed in this scanner, especially with the speed that it scans with and that it does both sides of the page or photo. It's pretty pricey for what it is, but if I figure my labor costs in compared to the time it saves, I guess it's worth it. It deserves five stars but I'm knocking one off for the price. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: LWB250

customer_reviews.title: software doesn't work with MAC
customer_reviews.text: Software will not open on my MAC. Spent over 30 minutes on the phone with Epson and they couldn't help me. He finally said maybe try Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Raymon Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic photo scanner. You wont believe how fast it is
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so we could scan in 8000+ photos from boxes while recovering from knee surgery. It was easy to set up, very reliable, and so blazingly fast. I doubt we had 10 double-feeds out of all the photos scanned. Scan quality was great. Software was OK on Windows 10 laptops and also on a Windows 7 desktop. Check out a video of this great scanner in action. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Glacierjay

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have thousands of pictures and so far have scanned about 3000 in only a few days. It took days as I had to decide on how to name the pictures otherwise it would have scanned them in a matter of hours. I have not had issues with jams unless there was damage to the photo and even some of those it scanned. My only wish is that it scanned negatives too.
customer_reviews.author: Cook

customer_reviews.title: For the price, this wasn't worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because I couldn't get the quality of the picture scans to meet my needs. I ended up sending them out to be scanned professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell I.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase !
customer_reviews.text: It's great , but I wish I could have waited a little later to buy the latest model . 1200 dpi or more would be better !
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Lai

customer_reviews.title: Great quality photos
customer_reviews.text: Scans photos fast and rarely jams. If it does it's because the photos have that stupid glue from the 'magnetic' photo albums. I am scanning a lifetime of photos, so this has been a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: KatWatson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Transferring hard copies of photos to digital back up was a long and tedious process before I found this. Already done with what took months to accomplish less then half the work. Not only did this make the work go quickly and save me stress and pains in just getting photos transferred, but the origination was made a breeze. Love love love it
customer_reviews.author: Holly Cumberland

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! I scanned a yellow/orange picture and the auto correct worked great. Still scanning old pics.
customer_reviews.author: Delia

customer_reviews.title: Epson will not work with military members
customer_reviews.text: Never worked out of the box, Stay away from Epson, they refused to repair the unit because I am US military and live overseas, Amazon however did give me a partial refund. I will never buy another of their products.
customer_reviews.author: AQ

customer_reviews.title: Great for scanning project
customer_reviews.text: So far we scanned a lot of pictures. The scanner is very sensitive to dust and particles. We had to wipe all pictures on both sides and every small batch of approximately 20 pictures, we cleaned the scanner inside out.
customer_reviews.author: AnielaS

customer_reviews.title: Best scanner for pictures & documents!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome scanner. It is so much easier and much more convenient that using a normal printer to scan pictures or documents. Very fast. Easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Carole B

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This scanner worked better than expected and save loads of time. It Scanned different size photos and thicknesses better than expected. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferrando

customer_reviews.title: Great for dealing with a batch of regular printed pictures
customer_reviews.text: This handles snapshots and larger pictures very well. The only issues are if the photos are thick (as in polarioid).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. S. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I got this scanner because I had stacks and stacks of old photos (back to the 90s!) that I wanted to scan and then recycle. It's very easy and intuitive to use and totally did the job. Glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Munson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've blow through several hundred pictures in a few hours, including some that are over 50 years old. The scanner balks at some of the thicker old-style photo prints, but in general it's done everything I expected of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Fast scanner and very easy to setup and get scanning. Highly satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: DML

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, FAST!
customer_reviews.text: I received what expected. Easy to setup and install software. Mine was refurbished so I didn't receive software but if you go on Epson.com it's easy to locate and install. So nice to have. Saves on time to be able to scan 30 prints instead of 4 on my flatbed scanner.
customer_reviews.author: mmr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and so very fast!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Fast and very efficient. Loaded soo many pics and very little time. I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimilani

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: Software kept crashing my Mac. Had to return the product after a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: James Deerhaven

customer_reviews.title: Scans fast
customer_reviews.text: Great product working very well scans just like it says it will
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Great for digitizing all those photos in boxes and albums.
customer_reviews.author: kirkandjan

customer_reviews.title: omg where has this been all my life!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because my grandma is moving and wanted to make all her photos digital. she has tons and tons. i also have tons. we have been orgnazing and scanning stacks in a few hours a night for about a week. i think we are getting close to the end with hers. it has saved us so much time. we love the fact that it scans the backs of the photo at the same time as the front. the only thing we dont like is it wont scan polaroid pictures so we have to do them with a glass top scanner.
customer_reviews.author: francheska

customer_reviews.title: Fast, accurate, fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: The scanning speed is extremely good. Scan quality is great. It’s pricey, but worth it compared to the time I was spending scanning photos on a flatbed scanner.
customer_reviews.author: RaleighRider

product_meta.title: Epson FastFoto FF-640 High-Speed Photo Scanning System with Auto Photo Feeder (Renewed)
product_meta.description:
Preserve what’s priceless. Quickly scan your photo collection in a whole new way with the innovative FastFoto FF-640 — the World’s Fastest Photo Scanner (1). Protect your photos and save time and money by doing it yourself. With the FF-640, you can scan thousands of photos — as fast as 1 photo per second (2) at 300 dpi. Single-step Technology automatically scans both the image and handwritten notes on the back. Restore faded photos, and upload high-quality images to the cloud. Seamlessly digitize life’s special memories. The FF-640 was designed to accommodate fragile photos or even large panoramic photos.

1. In its class, as compared to other consumer photo scanners priced under $1,000 MSRP USD (sold into the United States and Canada as of November 2015). 
2. Based on average speed from start of scan to end, using Windows driver, scanning thirty 4"" x 6"" photos at 300 dpi in landscape orientation. Auto-feed tray accommodates 30 photos at a time.
3. Based on letter-sized scans at 300 dpi in Black-and-White, Grayscale or Color Mode, using the USB interface.
4. For convenient and reasonable recycling options, visit www.epson.com/recycle
5. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.
feature_bullets: World’s Fastest Photo Scanner, scan thousands of photos as fast as 1 photo per second
High quality scans up to 600 dpi, scan precious images, from wallets to panoramic photos

Minimum system requirements: Windows 7, 8/8.1, 10, Mac OS 10.9.x to 10.12.x, software requires internet connection for download and installation.Preserve what’s priceless, Restore, Save, Organize and Share images
Based on average speed from start of scan to end, using Windows driver, scanning thirty 4 inches x 6 inches photos at 300 dpi in landscape orientation. Auto feed tray accommodates 30 photos at a time

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars72 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
